Class RocketShape

  • java.lang.Object
    • RocketShape
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Rocket

    public class RocketShape
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the shape of the rocket.
    Version:
    May 26, 2016
    Author:
    Tejasvi Kothapalli, Period: 3, APCS Final Project: LunarX, Sources: None

    • Constructor Detail

      • RocketShape

        public RocketShape(int x,
           int y)
        Constructs the rocket shape.
        Parameters:
        x - the X value of the starting coordinate of the rocket
        y - the Y value of the stating coordinate of the rocket

    • Method Detail

      • drawFilled

        public int drawFilled(java.awt.Graphics gr,
             boolean thrusters,
             boolean rightArrow,
             boolean leftArrow)
        Draws the rocket by filling in the shape drawn by the X and Y coordinates
        Parameters:
        gr - the Graphics object
        thrusters - the boolean that checks if the thrusters are ignited (the up arrow is being pressed)
        rightArrow - the boolean that checks if the rocket needs to rotate to the right (the right arrow key is being pressed)
        leftArrow - the boolean that checks if the rocket needs to rotate to the left (the left arrow key is being pressed)
        Returns:
        the new angle of the rocket

      • setRocketPolygon

        public void setRocketPolygon(int xVal,
                    int yVal)
        Sets the current rocket polygon coordinates by shifting it by the current X and Y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        xVal - the current X value coordinate position of the rocket
        yVal - the current Y value coordinate position of the rocket

        Parameters:

        Returns:
